column1: poor start, on the pads and Warner flicks through midwicket easily for a couple to open his account. 134 kph gentle loosener
full and straight again, much fuller than the previous one, worked to square leg this time
good length around off, Warner stays in his crease and defends
edged but just short of wide slip. Full delivery outside off, angled across, a thick outside edge dies in front of Rohit
good length around off, impeccable length to Warner, blocked away
walks right across to put Bhuvi's length off, shovels his caress to square leg
good length around off, getting that ball to seam back in, worked to mid-on
full delivery outside off, driven to cover. Kohli very conscious already of not giving Australia free runs through cover, he has four in the offside infield
terrific length, around off, on a length, blocked
finds extra cover. Full on off, the ball coming back in, Finch tries to work it through a gap, instead of go over it. Hits the fielder
excellent bowling this, fullish outside off, no seam or swing, but the lines are terrific. Defended
a maiden to start from Bumrah. Discipline already. Good length outside off, punched to mid-off
good length on middle and leg, Warner picks the wrong length to pull, an inside edge onto the pad and then towards point for a run. A half appeal from India
good length on off, 139 kph, blocked back
good length on middle, pushed to mid-on for a run. A very good single, Finch was 0 off 7, but didn't lose his calm
on a length around off and middle, 141 kph, inside-edged into the pad again
superb bowling this, on a length around middle, defended back
133 kph, around off on a length, tapped quietly towards point for a quick single. Well run
a tad short. Warner picks the length and pulls down to fine leg. Wanted that through square leg
struggling for timing early. Good length outside off, pushed to mid-on, tries to muscle that through cover
picks that a'right. Slightly short, an Finch knows the field. He can see that no one is there if he clears square leg, so he pulls well over the fielder

ooh, lightning outfield. These aren't short boundaries, nor are they pulled in, but this raced away. Short on middle and leg, Finch pulls through square leg, along the ground this time. Fine leg has no chance
good length outside off, punched up towards mid-off
good end. A tight delivery on middle, defended back to Bumrah, who picks up and feigns a throw back to Finch, doesn't let it go, never intended to
that's where Warner wanted to hit the first ball of the previous delivery. On a length on leg, Warner pulls through square leg with ease. Perfectly placed
fullish delivery on off, 138 kph, defended to mid-off
131 kph, some room, short and wide, slapped to cover
may have been the slower delivery, 122 kph, full and straight, nudged to square leg
nice and tight on off, 140 kph, defended away
drifts on the pads this time and Finch ain't letting that one by. Flicks behind square leg for a couple, nicely executed
another slower delivery, Warner picked it yesterday, on the pads and nonchalantly whipped through midwicket for two
no footwork. Good length outside off, sliced behind point for one to third man
full and straight, some seam movement back in, defended back. Bumrah is appealing for absolutely no reason
good length delivery on middle and leg, a thick inside edge to square leg
just over midwicket. Shortish on off, Warner has picked everything Bumrah has dished out. Stays back and jabs a stab over midwicket, didn't go through with the shot, let his muscle do that for him

shot of the day! Sensational batting. Short outside off, the ball coming back in, but Warner like he does so many times in the IPL, creates room by exposing his stumps (not a back away, just a subtle change) and powers a drive through extra cover.
on the pads, worked away to midwicket
on the pads, flicked to square leg for one
137 kph, full and straight, defended to mid-off
drifts on the pads again, an easy flick through square leg for one
a short slow delivery outside off, pushed away to mid-off
full and straight, driven up to mid-on, the bat coming down at an awkward angle which is why the ball went to mid-on, not straighter
another slower ball outside off, Warner stays in the crease and deflects the ball down to third man
on the pads again, and when you beat the infield in India, it's tough to cut it off. Finch clips this behind square for four. Short fine leg has no chance
on the pads again, Finch lifts the ball very intentionally over midwicket and it trickles into the fence this time
adjusts his line right away. Good length outside off, defended
fantastic hitting. 140 kph, full on middle and leg, Finch this time bunts a drive through mid-on with ease. Warner had to hurry out of the way
good length around off and middle, good adjustment, defended to mid-on
and again, no chance for anyone. Short on off, Warner stays in the crease and punches a square push into the gap at cover. How does he do that? It's a very good delivery
this though is width. Short and wide, slashed down to third man
good length outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
on a length around off, played into the off side
a good stop by cover. A short slow delivery outside off, hit towards cover's right, who gets down and stops the ball from racing past. Mid-off gets around top clean up
full outside off, Warner drives to mid-off from the back foot. Clearly misjudged the length of that, was anticipating something short
a short slow delivery on middle, flicked down to fine leg for one. The slower ball
looked to hit that over cover, but some extra bounce takes the outside edge, a slower ball outside off, a thick edge races down to third man
full outside off, a solid block to cover
eeks, Finch won't mind. Good length outside off, Finch tries to create room to hit through point but the ball takes the outside edge and races down to the third man boundary
a slower delivery to finish, on middle, worked to midwicket
flight outside off, driven to cover
the googly outside off, coming back in, driven to cover again
plenty of flight and loop, Warner reaches out for it and drives to cover
overpitched on off, driven back to the bowler but Kuldeep doesn't get down quickly enough and the ball finds a way through. One to long-off
79 kph, flight on middle and off, swept down to fine leg for one
runs down this time to get to the pitch, converts flight into a full toss and drives to long-on
shortish and wide, Warner plays this down to third man for a couple. A deft dab
on the pads again, nurdled down to fine leg

mis-timed and gone. Australia's man in touch is gone. A full delivery outside off from Pandya, Finch tries to go over mid-off, the right ball to hit, but can only skew the ball off the outside half towards Bumrah at mid-off, who rusn to his left, takes the catch, but the ball pops out. The ball is rolling all over his legs like an insect, but Bumrah uses his feel, not his sight, to hold on somehow. Made a simple catch look very tough. Excellent plan from Finch, just flawed execution
my gosh. That's his first ball. Overpitched from Pandya outside off, Smith leans on his drive and nails the cover drive. To the left of cover. Beautiful
full outside off, skewed off the outside half to deep point
a full slow delivery outside off, driven to cover. Nice over from Pandya
lots of flight on that outside off, Smith strides forward to defend
good stop. Flight on middle and leg, driven to Rahane at midwicket who dives to his left
the stock ball on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket again, with the spin
four in a row. Flighted on middle, worked to midwicket
the trajectory changes, shorter and quicker, Smith reads the googly well, goes back and plays towards gully
the second maiden of the innings. Flatter outside off, Smith stays back to defend. Nicely bowled
extremely full and wide, Warner reaches out and guides to deep point
a high full toss on middle and leg, whacked away to deep midwicket. Should have been put in the stands, but Smith doesn't take the bait just yet. Might have just been intentional, you kow
flat outside off, defended into the off side
flat and quick, but far too wide outside off, wide
quick on off, no turn at all. Pushed to cover
short and wide, scythed down to third man, where Axar dives away to his right
full and wide again, awkwardly played to cover
short and wide outside off, the ball turning in, cut to cover
terrific use of the feet, gets right to the pitch and flicks to deep midwicket
the reverse sweep, flat and straight, Warner just paddles that to backward point. Bumrah dives to his left
slightly short, Smith stays back and cuts towards the bowler
dances down and drives to long-off
nice finish, quick and straight,a thick inside edge towards square leg
wide arm, slingy action, wideeeee outside off. Warner reaches out and drives to deep point
90 kph, another full toss on middle, whipped to deep midwicket
slow and straight, full, defended back
short and wide, coming in, sliced to third man
flat and straight, worked to midwicket
drifts down leg, Smith tries to paddle but doesn't make contact
83 kph, on the pads, nudged to midwicket where Kohli dives away to his right
short and wide, Warner goes back and clobbers a pull to long-off
76 kph, googly on middle, Smith stays in his crease, reads the variation off the pitch and stabs a flick in time to square leg
the googly again, on middle and leg, worked to square leg
75 kph, lots of flight outside off, defended into the cover region
74 kph, Smith shuffles down and drives to long-off. Nicely played
drilled through cover. Lots of flight outside off, Warner nails a drive, gets it wide of cover and that races away. Waited for it
flight outside off, Smith runs down and drives to long-on. Too easy
flat outside off, blocked to point
overpitched and straight, pushed to long-off
short and straight, wide arm, punched to long-on
shortish outside off, Warner feigns a switch hit, but holds his stance and guides a cut to deep point
85 kph, short and wide, chopped away towards cover.
length ball on middle stump, clipped to square leg
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
back of a length, angling into off and middle. Punched down to long-on
flat and full close to off stump, driven hard but straight back to the bowler
a bit of flight now, full on off stump, clipped down to long-on
tossed up just outside off stump, driven to long-off
floated up slow and full on leg stump, flicked away through square leg
flat, round-arm, angled in on a good length towards off stump. Stays on the back foot and punches it to the left of the extra-cover fielder to bring up another fifty

gone! Jadhav does it again! A dangerous, dangerous shot, sweeping from the stumps - because of Jadhav's low arm, the ball follows a stump-to-stump trajectory right from the time it leaves his hand, when he's bowling from over the stumps. It's fairly flat, and it doesn't give him too much time to get down on one knee, and he's in a half-crouch when he swipes at it and misses, and he's struck absolutely plumb in front. The low bounce he generates is another reason to think twice about going across the line. That's pitching middle, hitting middle. Barely any turn.
tossed up slow, just outside off, driven to long-off
shortish, angling in from wide of the crease, chopped away to deep point
back of a length, goes with the angle - which is slightly away from off stump, that's how low his arm is getting - and Handscomb punches it to long-on
well bowled. Just a bit of turn, pitches off stump, just misses it, as Handscomb plays back in defence and down the wrong line
a bit fuller, blocked back to the bowler
a bit more air on it, a touch wider of off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length, some turn back in towards middle stump. Warner stays back, leg-side of the ball, to jab it past extra-cover and towards long-off
back of a length, angling into middle and off, punched back to the bowler
full, angling into leg stump, driven to long-on
full, slow, angling down leg, clipped gently into the square-leg region
nice length, angling in towards off stump, driven into the point region
back of a length, flat, angling into off stump and cramping Warner. Wants to flat-bat to long-off, maybe, and ends up hitting it back to the bowler
a bit of width, slapped to deep point
slow flight outside off, gets down low to sweep it through backward square leg
tossed up just outside off, driven past the diving extra-cover fielder to long-off
back of a length on middle and off, no turn, punched to long-off

down the track, and Warner's chipped this straight to long-on! Soft dismissal, but maybe he wanted to hit it a lot wider, looking to whip it in the air from outside off stump. The lack of turn may have forced him to hit it straighter, and long-on takes a nice catch running to his left
back of a length, angling into middle stump, punched to long-on
shortish outside off, but not too much width. Cut to backward point
length ball, a little slower, on off stump. Clipped down to long-on
full with a bit of flight on middle stump, defended inside-out into the point region
full on off stump. Drives hard, looking to hit straight of long-on, and Jadhav dives left to stop it
goes back to a length ball angling into middle stump, defends with a straight bat into the on side
shortish outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
floated up just outside off. Read the line well, Handscomb, stretched out and got his head over the ball to lap-sweep fine, just to the left of the keeper
shortish, turning in towards off stump, goes back and plays a whip-pull to the left of the man at square leg
full on off stump, defended to extra-cover
nice length, angling into off stump. Looks to drive to long-on and gets a leading-edge that loops to the left of that catcher at short extra

oh no. Another batsman falls to the sweep. This time it's extra bounce rather than lack of bounce, and Handscomb gets a top-edge that flies high behind the wicket. Rahane runs back from slip and judges it perfectly. This was flat, just outside off, and pitched shorter than Handscomb expected
length ball on off stump, clipped to short, straight midwicket
full, just outside off, driven to long-on
full on middle and off, blocked down the ground, towards the non-striker
speared in flat and full on leg stump, defended with a straight bat towards midwicket
round-arm length ball angling into off and middle. Goes back to defend into the covers
wider outside off now, gets on the front foot to slap to point
for once, Jadhav drops one in the slot for a big drive. Actually, Head made the length by stepping out of his crease, and drove powerfully past the bowler
tossed up a bit wider, driven to extra-cover
slow, on a good length outside off, defended into the covers
slows it up outside off, and Stoinis, shaping for the paddle-sweep, is too early into his shot, is hit on the pad
full outside off, driven to long-off
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off and middle, whipped to deep square leg

ooh, some dip and turn there, and Stoinis bisects keeper and slip. Stretched forward to defend, wasn't near the pitch of it - Axar had slowed it up considerably - and the outside edge finds the gap perfectly
again some turn, starts from wider outside off, stretches out to jab to point
full outside off, driven to short extra-cover
back of a length, angling into off stump, makes room and slaps to cover - the sweeper's been brought in to the edge of the circle now
flat, on the stumps, worked through square leg
tossed up on middle stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, makes some room for the flat-bat slap to long-off, past the diving extra-cover fielder
drops this on a nice length on off stump, presses forward to defend towards short midwicket
length ball close to off stump, clipped to short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to play that to short midwicket
tossed up fuller now, outside off, and Head drives between cover and extra-cover. Nice stride forward and a whip of the wrists to give it impetus
back of a length, just outside off, defended to short extra-cover
down the track now, whips this from off stump to the man at square midwicket
a bit of extra bounce. Looks to sweep this length ball turning in towards off stump, and the ball jumps and hits him on the hip
length ball turning down leg, Stoinis misses the sweep. Big appeal for caught behind, not given. Not called wide either. Maybe a tickle of pad?
length ball on the pads, clipped through square leg
fullish, angling into off stump. Looks for the drive to long-off. Kohli intercepts with a dive to his left from short extra
skips down the track now, clips this from just outside off down to long-on
tossed up slow outside off. Looks for the drive to long-off and Jadhav sprints to his left and dives to cut it off
full, angling down leg, clipped to long leg
slow length ball wide of off stump, Stoinis looks to sweep, misses
flat length ball that spins away from off stump. Stoinis is only half-forward in defence, and the thick outside edge runs away to the right of slip
flat length ball, this one goes with the angle. Again he's only half forward in defence and gets an inside-edge into his pad
back of a length, another slider, defended from the crease towards midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers

and again! Why is slip so wide? Length ball spins away from off stump, and again Stoinis is nowhere near the pitch while propping forward to defend. The outside edge beats Dhoni to his right, and slip is nowhere near it
angles this down the leg side, and Head capitalises, gets down quickly to sweep it nice and fine - short fine leg is rather square
down the track now, doesn't quite reach the pitch of this flat one outside off. Swings hard and hits it down to long-on, along the ground, off the inside half of the bat

down the track, and he's just cleared the leaping long-on fielder. Gets into a great position for the lofted drive, and hit it straight, so long-on had quite a distance to move to his left. Went a fair way over his head too
back of a length outside off, slapped into the covers
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on
back of a length outside off, stops on him and keeps low. Wanted to slap that through the covers, ends up flat-batting it back to the bowler
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to long leg
Stoinis was in position to sweep even before Axar released. Sends one down slightly shorter outside off, and the batsman adjusts, plays a controlled half-pull off one knee, through square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to straight midwicket
length ball on off stump, flat, defended to short extra
flat and full, angling into middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
short outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
the stock ball, flighted, turns sharply from middle and leg to outside leg. Looks to come forward and work it leg side, the ball beats inside edge and rolls into the short fine leg region off pad
shortish, goes back to flat-bat to long-off
length ball turning in towards middle and leg, goes forward to clip into the backward square leg region
down the track, meets the flighted ball on a middle-stump line and drags a drive down to long-on, past the bowler's right hand. He was a little slow bending down
excellent length. Draws Head forward with flight, and beats him with dip and sharp turn. Head's hands followed the ball, looking to jab through cover point

tossed up outside off, sharp turn again, and he misses the sweep. Or has he? Big appeal from Dhoni, and India have reviewed umpire Nandan's not-out decision. Was there a bottom edge? Ultra-edge says no.
back of a length, angling into off stump, lets it come on and tucks it into the midwicket region
length ball on middle stump, clipped through square leg
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot to defend back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched into the point region and Rahane moves quickly to his right from backward point to deny him the single
back of a length outside off, a little wider than the previous ball, left alone
full on off stump, driven firmly down the ground and Pandey stops it with a dive to his right from mid-on
down the track and Kuldeep slows it down considerably. Finds himself nowhere near the pitch of it as it turns down leg, and he sticks out his leg to pad it away
flatter, back of a length, tucked away through backward square leg
tossed up slow and wide of off. Goes for the big flat-bat drive and he's beaten by turn and bounce. Dhoni takes it over his shoulder, and falls backwards but still clings on
full outside off, driven back hard to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length, googly turning towards off stump, goes back to whip it to long-on
back of a length, straightens in the corridor close to off stump. Jumps back and across to defend towards backward point
short and wide, slapped away to the right of third man
fullish, angling across the left-hander and away from off stump. Goes for the big drive and misses
length ball on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, worked towards mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle stump. Defended back to the bowler
flight outside off, the stock ball, squeezed into the point region for a run
flat outside off, Stoinis goes right back in the crease to clip into the leg side
short down leg, worked away through square leg. Not giving too much room
overpitched and straight, flicked to midwicket. The line is straight
would have been wide had he left it, but this is a good result nonetheless. Short and wide, Head stretches out and clatters a slap wide of cover for a couple
the googly on middle, nudged to deep square leg
fullish length outside off, Head fails to connect with a slap. Bounces in front of Dhoni, who stops the ball with a grimace
full and wide outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man
a terrific yorker, on middle and leg. Stoinis jams it out just in time
lovely line. 132 kph, outside off, fuller than a good length. The ball zips past the outside edge. Lands well in front of Dhoni again
full and straight, Stoinis plays with an angled bat, and the ball skews back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, dabbed to point. Struggling to hit the gaps consistently
nails the slog sweep, but finds deep midwicket running to his right. Lots of flight on middle and off, hammered by Head
in the gap. Stoinis definitely has the ability to hit the ball, like this. Flight on middle and leg, Stoinis gets low and creams an uppish sweep in the gap at square leg
runs down at the bowler, but Kuldeep's googly is shorter, so Stoinis adjusts and keeps it out
doesn't quite get to the pitch. Australia probably attacking this last over of the second Powerplay. Stoinis runs down and skews a lofted drive to deep midwicket
short and wide, the stock ball, slashed to the sweeper cover

there is no one there. The googly, short and wide, the ball rips and spins away from Stoinis, who goes deep in the crease and slashes it in the gap at extra cover. That's terrific batting, Kuldeep though Stoinis was coming down
short outside off, the ball skids on, Head mis-times the pull to long-off
drifts down leg and Stoinis paddle sweeps down to fine leg
flat and straight, no turn, shovelled to midwicket
sees Head coming and fires this down leg, off the pad to square leg. Head undone but adjusted well
flat and straight, Stoinis defends
how did that not hit the stumps? Short and straight, the ball skids on, takes the inside edge and somehow misses the stumps. Two down to fine leg
short and wide again, too much width, Head rocks back and crashes a cut past cover for a couple
hammered! Gets low, premeditates the slog sweep, stays low and executes, over midwicket. Just in front of the boundary
short and wide again, slapped to long-off for one

a long appeal from Kuldeep, Dhoni bailed out of the appeal, but umpire Nandan gives it. Stoinis reviews right away. A low full toss outside off, Stoinis goes through with the sweep, but under-edges it onto his pad. A discernible spike on UltraEdge, and this decision should be overturned. 'I've got quite a big spike, the bat is not hitting the ground,' says the third umpire. A bad decision from umpire Nandan, but when a batsman sweeps a full delivery, seeing the edge or the line is really hard. A gasp of despair from Stoinis as the finger went up
just short of Axar, who did not go for the catch. A googly on middle, Stoinis comes down and outside-edges the variation towards short third man. Well bowled, shortened the length
flight outside off, driven back to the bowler
that's close! Head dances down the track and misses the flick, struck him just outside the line maybe
short outside off, a dragged pull to deep midwicket
short on off, pushed back to the bowler
very slow and wide outside off, Stoinis watches it go by. Axar anticipated Stoinis coming down
pushed back to the bowler
flat down leg, clipped to square leg

94 kph, Head is gone. Premeditating the sweep, Axar is all too familiar with it. He fires it full and straight, Head tries to bail out of his sweep, but is in no position to improvise, the ball finds the gap, a big gap, between bat and pad and hits the stumps
the googly outside off, punched to deep point from the back foot. Wanted the conventional sweep, but adjusted well
toe-ends the ball back to the bowler. Sweepy Wade gets down immediately, but plays it too early
short outside off, worked to deep midwicket off the back foot
the googly. So much extra bounce because of the revs through the variation, Stoinis watches it onto his cut and finds deep point
executed this time. A low full toss is swept fine towards fine leg. Bhuvi picks up and fires at the right end, the bowler's end, but Stoinis makes it in time
good length around off, the ball seams back in, pushed back to the bowler

given by umpire Erasmus. Stoinis reviews again. Umpire's call will decide this. Full on off, the ball has seamed back in prodigiously and struck Stoinis in front of off, beaten by discernible late lateral movement. No bat. Impact is umpire's call so Stoinis has to walk back. Fell over his stroke slightly
full and straight again, Faulkner gets forward to defend

edged, has it carried? Dhoni isn't sure. A good length delivery outside off, Faulkner gets a thick outside edge, Dhoni dives to his right, gets forward, the ball juggles out and Dhoni collects the bobble, but that has landed well in front of Dhoni. Faulkner will carry on. Some dust and some chalk explode. 'The ball has clearly bounced,' says the third umpire
full and straight again, pushed away to mid-on. Another dot. Five on the bounce
beaten on the outside edge. Fantastic bowling from Bumrah. Full outside off, Faulkner is beaten on the outside edge, the ball bounces in front of Dhoni, and ricochets away, enabling the bye
on the pads to start from Bhuvi, nudged down to fine leg
good length delivery on off, Wade is rushed on his pull, gets one to midwicket
sees Faulkner coming and hits that hard length, short outside off, mis-timed to cover. The dots racking up
on the pads, bat on ball to square leg. Losing momentum
a low full toss, Wade drives the ball straight back to Bhuvneshwar. Pressure building
full and very wide outside off, 123 kph, miscued back to the bowler. Another dot. Just 19 runs off the last five overs.
good length on off, muscled to mid-off for one. Wanted more than one
138 kph, looking for the paddle scoop. A yorker on off, Wade toe-ends it back again.
full on off, skewed away to deep point for one. The ball moving away late
a yorker on leg, nudged to deep midwicket, just the one again.
wow, a lucky two. A slower ball down leg, Wade is too early through his flick, toe-ends it away to deep midwicket. Bumrah chases after it, two easy
another slower delivery to finish, 119 kph, on off, worked to square leg. Just six off that over
he has hit that well enough. Full and wide outside off, Wade gets underneath the length and gets enough power to clear mid-off. Tried to hit that over cover, but all muscle
good yorker there. On middle and off, jammed back to the bowler who parries it away while diving to his right
a low full toss on middle and leg, driven back to Wade, who had to hurry out of the way. Pandya gets across from long-on
good idea, decent execution. Wanted to hit that over square leg, the slower ball on leg, Wade got that over square leg but not enough power behind it. A couple
a fine low full toss on off, driven away to long-off, just one. India will be happy with this
terrific bowling, another low full toss, driven to long-on. 12 off it, a decent over for Australia

full and straight, skewed away to midwicket. Faulkner races back for the second, Wade looks and sends Faulkner back far too late. The throw to the bowler lands in front of Bumrah who allows it go by, allowing Faulkner to run back to make his crease. Sloppy
full and straight, a miscued loft to long-on, on the bounce
a wide slower ball outside off, mis-timed to cover for another single.
looked like the bat went as far as the ball. Wade runs down, converts the yorker into a low full toss and squeezed that to deep point for one. Bat and ball lands safely
mis-timed badly to long-on. A low full toss again, Faulkner can only bunt it away to long-on. Wade struggling to catch his breath back

135 kph, straight to the sweeper cover. Just five off that. A low full toss outside off, Wade gets underneath that but can only slice it away to the man on the sweeper boundary. Wade tried but that's a slightly under-par cameo
dropped by Pandya. A low full toss from Bhuvi, Faulkner smashes it to long-on, where Pandya runs in, but drops it. Couldn't keep up with his momentum
good length on off, slapped away to deep midwicket. Pandey is quick on it. Just one
full and wide outside off, Faulkner reaches out but can only find the sweeper cover.
full and straight again, all Cummins can do is drive to long-on, with the direction of swing. Another single

run-out! A 123 kph slower ball wide outside off, Faulkner can only mis-time it to long-on, he wants to retain strike for the final ball, and runs back but was never going to make it. Dhoni collects the ball and removes the bails with Faulkner a foot short
misses a full, straight ball. 138 kph, full on off, Coulter-Nile winds up and looks to unfurl a big swing, but fails to connect at all. The off stump is uprooted
shortish, a bit of inward nip as Rahane looks to defend, ends up playing slightly outside the line. Appeal for lbw, but that definitely struck him too high, on the left thigh pad
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers

length ball on middle stump, and that's beautifully played. Just leaned forward, let the ball arrive under his eyes, and met it with a straight bat, turning his wrists at the moment of contact to send it running away to the left of square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
a little fuller, similar line as the previous ball, angling into off stump. Lets it come on and defends to mid-on
full, fourth-stump line, defended to mid-off. Just a bit of outswing, as always
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
shortish, fourth-stump line, lets it come on and opens his bat face to dab it down to third man
good ball. Back of a length, fifth-stump line, just a bit of late shape away. Rohit hangs his bat away from his body, neither defending nor attacking, and is beaten by the movement
back of a length on off stump, defended back towards the bowler. Straightened again, and squared up the batsman slightly
back of a length, angling into middle and off, clipped to square leg
fullish, close to off stump, and Rahane is a little early into his straight drive, checks his shot slightly, but times it so well that it races away unstoppably between non-striker and umpire
back of a length, fourth-stump line. Looks for that single to third man again, and Smith dives left from backward point to deny him. We saw a lot of this in Bengaluru too
back of a length, angling into off stump. Takes a step back and across and pushes gently to the right of mid-on
length ball on off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
length ball, fourth-stump line. Looks to play the stand-up drive on the up, doesn't really time it and can't beat the man at cover
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to mid-on
length ball on off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on. Doesn't put as much weight on the shot as with the previous ball, and as a result he gets an easy single
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
a bit of extra bounce and some inward movement towards off and middle. Looks to clip into the leg side and the ball hits him on the thigh pad
back of a length, fifth-stump line, opens his bat face for a push to backward point

good ball. Angled in towards off stump, and it straightens just a bit. Rohit was looking to play it with the angle, into the leg side, and had to adjust late to play it towards the bowler off the outside half of his bat
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
length ball close to off stump. Lets it come on and opens his bat face to place it to the right of third man
fullish on off stump, driven crisply to mid-off

all those dot balls, and Rohit goes for a big hit. Back of a length, angling into off stump. Swings at it, looking to hit over mid-on, and inside-edges into his pad. Loops up in the air, and fortunately for the batsman drops short of Cummins's stretch
and now he's off the mark. Overpitched, for once, angling into off stump, and all he has to do is meet it with the full face and drive back past the bowler, to the right of mid-off
two in two. Not overpitched like the previous one, but full nonetheless, and he extends his arms through another drive to hit over the top, to the right of mid-off
length ball, fourth-stump line. Stretches forward and across to clip to midwicket
oh wow. What a shot. That's a perfectly good length, just a few inches outside off, and he leans forward and drives on the up, between cover and mid-off
length ball on off stump, shows the full face for a push to mid-on
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball, fourth-stump line, punched hard but straight back to the bowler
shortish, close to off stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and defend towards backward point
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length, fourth-stump line, dabbed down to third man
full, angling into leg stump. Shows the full face to drive to long-on
back of a length, angling into middle and leg. Cramps Rahane for room as he tries to whip it off his hip. Can't put much power on it and it rolls down towards midwicket
short outside off. Rohit looks to pull, and is through his shot a little early. The ball hits him on the back arm
short again, this one sits up at waist height on off stump. Pulled straight to square leg
short, wide, and again Rohit smacks one straight to a fielder. Stands up tall and slaps it straight to Head at cover point
back of a length on off stump. Looks to punch through the covers but it stops on him and he ends up hitting it towards mid-on, off the inside half of his bat

slower ball, full and fairly wide outside off. Maybe wanted to bait him into an uppish drive, but Rohit got a nice stride in, got his head over the ball, and drove all along the ground, to the right of cover point
slower ball, back of a length outside off, beats Rohit's edge as he tries to run it down to third man
back of a length close to off stump, punched firmly to the left of mid-off
down the track and he bangs it in short. Pulled away through square leg
shortish, angling into middle stump, and that's nicely played. Steps across his stumps and helps it away to the left of short fine leg, front leg going up in a prace
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards backward point
back of a length, angling into the pads. Poor ball with fine leg inside the circle, but he gets away with it, Rohit tucking it straight to the fielder
back of a length close to off stump, punched to mid-off
starts with a full ball outside off, and Rahane puts it away easily. Leans forward and drives to the right of extra-cover, and the timing's so good long-off has no chance
pulls his length back slightly, Rahane presses forward and pushes to long-off
back of a length outside off. Reaches out and steers to short third man
steps down the track and Faulkner bowls a back-of-a-length slower ball outside off. Punched to extra-cover
slower length ball on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
slower ball, back of a length, fourth-stump line. Defended towards backward point
starts with a nicely flighted legbreak on off stump and Rahane drives to long-off. A checked drive - he was a little early on that, and the ball was in the air briefly
length ball spinning towards off stump, opens his bat face to slice to backward point
goes back to a length ball on off stump, punches to cover point
down the track to the flighted ball, meets it on the full and jabs to long-off
short, a bit of width, stabbed straight to backward point but a fumble allows a single
down the track again, clips this one down to long-on
full on off stump, clipped back down the pitch. Head moves to his right but can't quite get down in time and the ball trickles away towards long-on
ooh, some turn, and it stops on Rohit as well. Back of a length, and he plays with a straight bat and it loops up in the air but safely down to long-on
on leg stump now and he clips it away through square leg
tossed up a bit slower, stretches forward to drive to long-on
down the track to the flighted ball outside off, drives to long-off
tossed up slow outside off, and Rohit presses forward and uses his wrists deftly to clip it with the turn to the right of square leg
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs towards backward point
down the track, and was he looking to hit that inside-out? Wrong'un, and he inside-edges into the fine-leg region

another edge! This time Rohit looks to drive inside-out, from a leg line, and the ball dips and turns and the outside edge runs away to the right of the keeper. No slip, though. A bit of inward drift forced him to go inside-out
quicker now, on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
loopy full-toss wide of off, driven to the right of sweeper cover
ah, no. Twice he's found the edge, but it ends up as a good over for India. Ends it with a long-hop, and Rahane swivels to pull it away through square leg
tossed up outside off, presses forward to defend into the covers
down the track and Head shortens his length, pulled away to the left of long leg
tossed up full outside off, Rahane takes a big stride forward and almost yorks himself as he jabs to cover
down the track, and Rahane picks up another two. Good ball, though. Dipped on Rahane, and an attempted cover drive rolls away through midwicket off the inside half of the bat
a bit straighter, clipped through square leg
tossed up outside off, drops onto a nice length, defended into he covers
down the track and Zampa tosses it up wider. Frees his arms to hit that in the air, on the bounce, to long-off
back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease to use his wrists and work it down the ground to long-on. Again, Zampa moves to his right and stretches, but can't stop the single
Loopy full-toss on off stump, and Rahane puts it away, drives inside-out to beat sweeper cover to his right
floated up full, wider than the previous ball, driven to sweeper cover
full-toss on middle stump, clipped to long-on
long-hop, pulled to deep midwicket

dip, and sharp turn from outside off. Presses forward to defend, then tries to adjust to the dip and work it into the leg side. The ball spins past his inside edge and hits his pad high and loops up to the left of the keeper. Wade got there quickly and appealed for caught-behind, but there was no bat on it
down the track now, gets to the pitch to clip to long-on
flighted and full on off stump, clipped to long-on
flatter now, on off stump, punched back to the bowler
nicely flighted on off stump, clipped to the left of square leg
flighted ball wide of off, driven into the square cover region
length ball on off stump, driven to long-on
back of a length, stops on Rohit and nips in slightly towards middle stump. Adjusts for the lack of pace and defends back to the bowler
fullish outside off and Rohit plays a checked drive to the left of mid-off, where Finch makes a diving stop
back of a length, fourth-stump line, punched firmly back to the bowler
fullish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball wide of off, Rahane gets down on one knee and plays a flat-bat drive to deep point
on the pads from Head, nudged to square leg. Slow spin
good stop there from Smudge. Flat on leg, clipped to Smith at midwicket, who dives to his right. Keeps the pressure on
Head sees Rahane coming and fires this wide outside off, defended back
whipped away delectably through square leg. Slightly too short and slow, enough time for Rahane
takes on the fielder at long-on, and just clears! Flight outside off, Rohit dances down, gets to the pitch and wallops this over long-on with ease. Long boundary, Warner leaps, but it clears the man
steps out again, converts flight into a full toss and drills a drive through cover. Superb batting. Pressure back on Australia to make a play
a cutter outside off, glided off the open face to third man
full delivery outside off, Rohit watchfully plays this towards cover
on the pads, Rohit works this away past midwicket for a couple, brings up his fifty, another one in the series
full delivery outside off, driven away to mid-off. No run there, as the fielder is quick on it
133 kph, lovely stroke making. Comes down, sees a short delivery and helps his pull easily over midwicket. That's not good bowling, just sits up for Rohit
short and wide this time, cut away easily past point for a couple. The sweeper cover had to run around that, not a good over. Smith needs to do something.
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler, who feigns a throw, which displeases the crowd
good stop again. Shortish outside off, bunted away towards cover, who gets across to his right
127 kph, slower delivery on middle and leg, Rahane comes charging at Faulkner and goes through with a nothing hoick. Luckily for him, it is badly timed. The fielder takes it on the bounce
good length on middle and leg, nudged away to midwicket. Soft hands means India get one
full around off, driven up to mid-on. Boos as Rahane stays on 49
beautiful shot to get to fifty. Full and straight, Rahane drills the ball right back at Faulkner, who has no time to get his hands up. Great place to hit the ball, fourth straight fifty for Rahane
130 kph, on a length outside off, defended towards point
137 kph, a short slow delivery outside off, dabbed down to third man
another glide off the face of the ball down to third man
ooh, a slower delivery, 138 kph, Rohit is though his shot but adjusts quickly, gets one down to fine leg
goes wide of the crease, good length delivery outside off, punched to cover
tidy over. Just four off it, but not good enough for Australia. On a length outside off, a dab down to third man.
chipped to long-off. Full outside off, Rahane goes through with his uppish drive
good length outside off, Rohit tries to hit on the up but a thick outside edge trickles down to third man
good length delivery outside off, Rahane stays in his crease and punches a drive to cover

was there a deflection? Yes, thinks Faulkner. Short and wide, Rahane tries to glide it past Wade, but the ball goes on. Can't see anything conclusive. Wade can't collect cleanly as the ball pops out. Yes, UltraEdge has a spike so a drop
more strong bottom hand. On a length on middle, flicked away to square leg
good stop from Cummins, short and wide, slashed through point. Cummins runs around to his left and hauls it in.
full delivery outside off, punched away to cover from the crease
into the gap behind square for another boundary. Full and straight. Rahane flicks and finds the gap at the backward square leg boundary

and out, says umpire Erasmus. On a length on middle, Rahane misses a flick and is struck on the pad. Was he moving across too far? Was it sliding down leg? Rahane opts to review. No bat on that, so an umpire's call will do for Australia. Two reds, and clipping the bails, so Rahane will have to go. Had just shuffled across too far
full and straight from Coulter-Nile. Kohli gets his bat right behind the line to defend. Don't think he'll be gliding too many
good length outside off, goes wide of the crease and defends under his eyes. Good from Coulter-Nile, has been bustling in
full outside off, Kohli would have got off the mark if that man was back, but Kohli stays on 0. A nice press into his drive to extra cover
short and wide from Zampa, tripe. Rohit stays back and slashes a cut behind point, too easy
a low full toss outside off, driven to long-off with so much ease. Struggling for control
short and wide outside off, slapped to Smith at cover who lets the ball go through to long-off
loads of flight on that on leg, driven to long-on
a lovely drive with the spin to the sweeper cover
good finish, flat on leg. Blocked back
141 kph, full outside off, some seam movement back in, driven to mid-off
good length on the pads, nurdled away to deep square leg
a short delivery on off, Rohit helps it along to deep square leg. Kept that down
full outside off, 139 kph, goes wide of the crease again, a nice drive finds Warner at extra cover
full and straight again, nudged away easily to deep square leg.
136 kph, full delivery outside off, dabbed to point. Just played him out
nicely bowled, quick and straight, Kohli gets right forward and inside-edges a defensive prod into his pad. Zampa appeals
not good fielding from Australia. Lots of flight on that outside off, driven past cover for a couple. The cover fielder just escorted that to the deep sweeper fielder
lots of flight on off, driven with the spin to long-off
loop and flight outside off, driven to Smith at cover
beautiful. Lots of flight on that outside off, Rohit gets forward and lifts the ball easily over cover. Inside-out
the googly on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
good length on middle and leg, nudged away to midwicket
on a length outside off, dabbed to point.
139 kph, on a length outside off, Kohli is looking for that dab down to third man but finds backward point
another one, trying to find one to third man. That's relatively safe though because it's wide outside off, beats the outside edge
five dot balls from Cummins. Good length outside off, glided off the face to backward point. These are terrific lines
good length outside off, Kohli stays back and punches a cut to the sweeper cover from the crease.
too much flight from Zampa, which means the ball is too full. Kohli eases into a drive to long-off
drops too short this time, Zampa throws his head back in disgust. Pushed to long-on
far too much flight outside off, an easy skew to deep point for two very easy runs.
gets it past third man, three more. Short and wide outside off, a deft dab down to third man for three. Cummins hauls it in
the googly outside off, flicked to long-on. These two milking Zampa with no trouble at all
91 kph, the worst ball is a dot. A full toss outside off is driven to cover
good length outside off, 146 kph, tapped to backward point
full around off, Rohit stays in the crease to defend. Very clever batting, play their best bowlers out
nicely played. Lets the ball come to him before guiding it past point for two more
good length outside off, 139 kph, glided off the face of the bat to point
beautifully punched from the crease to the sweeper cover. Stands tall and drills a push
good end, 145 kph, short delivery on middle, Kohli ducks out of the way hurriedly. Nice change in length
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off
turn, and the ball stops on Kohli. Comes in towards his pads, and he punches it uppishly, with a carefully straight bat, to long-on
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
tossed up slower outside off, stretches out and drives to cover
back of a length, turns in towards off stump, punched to extra-cover
floated up slow on middle stump, clipped to square leg off the front foot
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region. Kohli wanted one, Rohit sent him back, rightly. Smith hared in from backward point to hunt that ball down
shortish and a bit of width, but it nipped away ever so slightly. Looked like the cross-seam release. Rohit slashed and missed
shortish, angling into middle stump. Looks to help it into the fine-leg region, but the ball doesn't bounce as high as he expects and hits his thigh pad before rolling into the leg side
fullish, close to off stump. Drives firmly back down the ground, and Cummins sticks out his left hand to stop it in his follow-through
hits a nice length just outside off, and gets it to nip away and bounce a touch extra to beat Rohit's attempted glide to third man
length ball close to off stump, Kohli looks for the drive but has to check himself, with the ball stopping slightly, and ensure that the uppish shot falls short of extra-cover
length ball turning in towards off stump, lets it come on and dabs into the backward point region
down the track, and that's nicely done. Gets fairly close to the pitch of this flighted ball outside off, and uses his bottom hand to whip it over midwicket
shortish outside off, some extra bounce to beat the attempted cut. Wade drops it, not sure if Kohli edged it or not
length ball on the pads, clipped towards backward square leg
slow length ball outside off, lets it come and dabs towards backward point

down the track, and Rohit hoists that over wide long-on. Ensures he doesn't get too close to the pitch of it, opens up at the hips, and just extends his arms through his shot. Big boundary there, but he aimed at a vacant spot to the right of long-on, and just cleared the rope
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and guides it to third man
short outside off, waits on it and opens his bat-face to ramp it to the left of third man. Didn't look to hit it hard, just let the ball hit his bat
back of a length outside off, Kohli opens his bat face and picks up another single to third man
back of a length, fourth-stump line, stands up tall and punches to the right of sweeper cover. they take two, but Rohit  struggled through the second run
back of a length outside off, and Rohit brings up 6000 ODI runs with a dabbed single to third man. The ninth Indian to get there.
fullish, close to off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball outside off, presses forward and opens his bat face to steer through point
short outside off, and it stops and keeps low and takes an age to reach Rohit, who just taps it on its head to flat-bat it towards long-on
short outside off, cut hard but straight to backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
back of a length outside off, takes ages to reach Rohit. Uses his wrists to clip it to long-on
back of a length wide of off, stabbed into the point region
full outside off and Kohli climbs into a drive, only to hit it straight to the man at extra-cover
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man
short outside off. Rohit swivels into a pull and it keeps low and stops on him. Bottom-edges it and it rolls to the right of the keeper
another short ball that struggles to reach Rohit. Shapes to pull again, ends up dragging it along the ground to mid-on, off the toe-end
fullish on off stump, blocked to mid-off

there it is. Finally a short ball gets up to a reasonable height, on or around off stump, and he pulls it away over midwicket and it carries all the way to bring up his 14th ODI hundred. This has been a superb innings in difficult conditions for someone who really relishes the ball coming on to the bat
short outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
nicely bowled, a bit of turn from a good length outside off. Reaches away from his body after pressing forward, and the ball beats his outside edge
full, angled into middle and leg. Shapes to work it leg-side, adjusts for the slow pace and defends with the full face, back to the bowler
turn again, sharp turn away from the stumps. Looks to sweep and it hits him on the hip
back of a length now, on the stumps, punched to long-on
tossed up outside off, presses forward and defends into the point region
short outside off, slapped to deep point
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
short, angling slightly down leg, and Rohit puts it away. Moves across and plays a controlled pull, off one leg, through backward square leg
short again, this time he has to pull from outside off to the man at deep square leg, who's well in front of square
short once more, pulled to deep square leg
short again, on off stump, and Rohit doesn't care if it isn't going to come on to the bat. He hits it early, and launches it over long-on. That is some shot
how slow is this pitch now? Goes for an inside-out drive, and his bat jams into the ground before inside-edging the ball back towards the bowler
back of a length, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length again, stops on the batsman, and he adjusts with his wrists to jab that to the right of sweeper cover
length ball turning towards off stump. Rohit defends inside-out, and the ball rolls way towards backward point off the outside half of his bat
long-hop, sits up on off stump, and he clears his front leg and smacks it over midwicket to bring up his first boundary
back of a length outside off, waits on it and dabs it to the left of short third man

back of a length, angling down leg, Kohli can't connect with the flick. Faulkner's reviewed umpire Erasmus's not-out decision for caught behind. Interesting. The third umpire's checking for stumping as well. Is there a slight deflection? Can't really tell. Nothing on ultra-edge. And he hasn't lifted his back foot either
back of a length, close to off stump, nice use of the hands to guide that down to third man
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, defended to midwicket
and another. Short on off stump, and Rohit's decided he's going to hit them early today and hit them over long-on. That's almost a drive rather than a pull
full on middle and off, driven hard down the ground, on the bounce, to the right of long-off
shortish on off stump, punched to the right of sweeper cover
full on off stump, leans back and flat-bats down the ground to the right of long-off

long-hop, and Rohit is out to a tired shot. What an innings, though. Looks to pull, ends up getting more height and less distance than he desired, and the man at deep midwicket comes in off the boundary and catches it a foot off the ground
tossed up on middle stump, stretches forward to block
short on off stump, and Kohli puts it away, pulling hard and flat over midwicket

such a good-looking shot, and it may have been six in Bengaluru, but here it's caught by long-off, comfortably. Tossed up on off stump, and he looks to loft this inside-out, ends up scooping it straight into the hands of long-off
long-hop, Jadhav drags a pull from outside off and picks up a one-bounce four over midwicket. This has been a terrible over, and he's picked up two wickets
good ball, doesn't turn as much as Jadhav expects. Wanted to dab it down to third man, but it slid on straight and he inside-edged it into the pitch
back of a length, angling into middle and off, clipped to midwicket
full outside off, driven to extra-cover
full, angling into off stump. Pandey looks to drive through cover, bottom-hand takes over and the bat comes down at an angle, and he gets a thick outside edge to third man
shuffles out of his crease, towards off stump. Faulkner shortens his length and he dabs to backward point
slower length ball close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, angling into off stump, Jadhav plays a copybook back-foot defensive. Maybe more open at the hips and shoulders than the textbook would recommend, but perfect for the inward angle
googly pitching wide of off, on a good length. Lots of turn and bounce, but still a safe leave for Pandey
back of a length on middle stump, goes deep in his crease to clip through square leg
length ball, quickish, turning from middle to off. Gets on the front foot to defend
fired in full, angling down leg, Misses the flick and it rolls off the pad to short fine leg
down the pitch now, gets to the pitch and drives to long-off
tossed up outside off, presses forward for a gentle push to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, clipped to midwicket with a turn of the wrists
back of a length, close to off stump, jabbed back towards the bowler
back of a length on off stump. Looks for a soft-hands single into the off side, but backward point moves in quickly to deny him
full, angling into off stump, and he clears his front leg and swipes it away between mid-on and midwicket

and that is that. Full outside off, and that bottom hand comes into play as he smears a drive down the ground. Jadhave gets his feet out of the way at the non-striker's end to let the ball streak to the long-on boundary
